info.description: This is the secure API for the agreement bot.
info.title: Agreement Bot Secure API

get.description: This API does compatibility check for the given deployment policy (or a pattern), service definition, node policy and node user input. It does both policy compatibility check and user input compatibility check. If the result is compatible, it means that, when deployed, the node will form an agreement with the agbot and the service will be running on the node.

parameters.description: Return the compatibility check result for all the service versions referenced in the deployment policy or pattern.
parameters.name: checkAll

parameters.description: Show the input which was used to come up with the result.
parameters.name: long

parameters.description: The exchange id of the node. Mutually exclusive with node_policy and node_user_input.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: The architecture of the node.
parameters.name: node_arch

parameters.description: The type of the node. It can be device or cluster. The default is device. It can be omitted if node_id is specified.
parameters.name: node_type

parameters.description: The kubernetes namespace for the node with cluster type. The default namespace is openhorizon-agent. It can be omitted if node_id is specified or the node_type is device.
parameters.name: node_cluster_namespace

parameters.description: The node policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with node_id.
parameters.name: node_policy

parameters.description: The user input that will be put in the exchange for the services. Mutually exclusive with node_id.
parameters.name: node_user_input

parameters.description: The exchange id of the deployment policy. Mutually exclusive with business_policy. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy_id

parameters.description: The defintion of the deployment policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy

parameters.description: The exchange id of the pattern. Mutually exclusive with pattern. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern_id

parameters.description: The pattern that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern

parameters.description: The service policy that will be put in the exchange. They are for the top level service referenced in the deployment policy. If omitted, the service policy will be retrieved from the exchange. The service policy has the same format as the node policy.
parameters.name: service_policy

parameters.description: An array of the top level services that will be put in the exchange. They are refrenced in the deployment policy or pattern. If omitted, the services will be retrieved from the exchange.
parameters.name: service

get.description: This API does the policy compatibility check for the given deployment policy, node policy and service policy. The deployment policy and the service policy will be merged to check against the node policy. If the result is compatible, it means that, when deployed, the node will form an agreement with the agbot and the service will be running on the node.

parameters.description: Return the compatibility check result for all the service versions referenced in the deployment policy or pattern.
parameters.name: checkAll

parameters.description: Show the input which was used to come up with the result.
parameters.name: long

parameters.description: The exchange id of the node. Mutually exclusive with node_policy.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: The architecture of the node.
parameters.name: node_arch

parameters.description: The type of the node. It can be device or cluster. The default is device. It can be omitted if node_id is specified.
parameters.name: node_type

parameters.description: The kubernetes namespace for the node with cluster type. The default namespace is openhorizon-agent. It can be omitted if node_id is specified or the node_type is device.
parameters.name: node_cluster_namespace

parameters.description: The node policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with node_id.
parameters.name: node_policy

parameters.description: The exchange id of the deployment policy. Mutually exclusive with business_policy.
parameters.name: business_policy_id

parameters.description: The defintion of the deployment policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id.
parameters.name: business_policy

parameters.description: The service policy that will be put in the exchange. They are for the top level service referenced in the deployment policy. If omitted, the service policy will be retrieved from the exchange. The service policy has the same format as the node policy.
parameters.name: service_policy

get.description: This API does the secret binding compatibility check for the given deployment policy (or a pattern) and service definition. It checks if each secret defined in a serice has a binding associated in the given deployment policy (or pattern) and each bound secret exists in the secret manager. If the result is compatible, it means that, when deployed, the node will form an agreement with the agbot and the service will be running on the node.

parameters.description: Return the compatibility check result for all the service versions referenced in the deployment policy or pattern.
parameters.name: checkAll

parameters.description: Show the input which was used to come up with the result.
parameters.name: long

parameters.description: The exchange id of the node. Mutually exclusive with node_user_input.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: The architecture of the node.
parameters.name: node_arch

parameters.description: The organization of the node.
parameters.name: node_org

parameters.description: The exchange id of the deployment policy. Mutually exclusive with business_policy. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy_id

parameters.description: The defintion of the deployment policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy

parameters.description: The exchange id of the pattern. Mutually exclusive with pattern. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern_id

parameters.description: The pattern that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern

parameters.description: An array of the top level services that will be put in the exchange. They are refrenced in the deployment policy or pattern. If omitted, the services will be retrieved from the exchange.
parameters.name: service

get.description: This API does the user input compatibility check for the given deployment policy (or a pattern), service definition and node user input. The user input values in the deployment policy and the node will be merged to check against the service uer input requirement defined in the service definition. If the result is compatible, it means that, when deployed, the node will form an agreement with the agbot and the service will be running on the node.

parameters.description: Return the compatibility check result for all the service versions referenced in the deployment policy or pattern.
parameters.name: checkAll

parameters.description: Show the input which was used to come up with the result.
parameters.name: long

parameters.description: The exchange id of the node. Mutually exclusive with node_user_input.
parameters.name: node_id

parameters.description: The architecture of the node.
parameters.name: node_arch

parameters.description: The type of the node. It can be device or cluster. The default is device. It can be omitted if node_id is specified.
parameters.name: node_type

parameters.description: The kubernetes namespace for the node with cluster type. The default namespace is openhorizon-agent. It can be omitted if node_id is specified.
parameters.name: node_cluster_namespace

parameters.description: The user input that will be put in the exchange for the services. Mutually exclusive with node_id.
parameters.name: node_user_input

parameters.description: The exchange id of the deployment policy. Mutually exclusive with business_policy. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy_id

parameters.description: The defintion of the deployment policy that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id and pattern.
parameters.name: business_policy

parameters.description: The exchange id of the pattern. Mutually exclusive with pattern. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern_id

parameters.description: The pattern that will be put in the exchange. Mutually exclusive with pattern_id. Mutually exclusive with business_policy_id and business_policy.
parameters.name: pattern

parameters.description: An array of the top level services that will be put in the exchange. They are refrenced in the deployment policy or pattern. If omitted, the services will be retrieved from the exchange.
parameters.name: service

get.description:
Authenticates the node user with the exchange. Checks if the vault plugin being used is ready.
Performs sanity checks on the secret user and secret name provided.
get.summary: Common setup required before using the vault to manage secrets.

parameters.description: The organisation name the secret belongs to. Must be the same as the org the user node belongs to.
parameters.name: org

parameters.description: The user owning the secret.
parameters.name: user

parameters.description: The node the secret is for.
parameters.name: node

parameters.description: The secret key (name).
parameters.name: secret

get.summary: List given secret belonging to the org for a node.

post.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the org for a node.

parameters.description: The secret key and value.
parameters.name: secretDetails

delete.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the org for a node.

get.summary: List given secret belonging to the user for a node.

post.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the user for a node.

parameters.description: The secret key and value.
parameters.name: secretDetails

get.summary: List given secret belonging to the user.

post.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the user.

parameters.description: The secret key and value.
parameters.name: secretDetails

delete.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the user for a node.

get.summary: List given secret belonging to the org.

post.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the org.

parameters.description: The secret key and value.
parameters.name: secretDetails

delete.summary: Delete a given secret belonging to the org.

IdentityToken.description: An opaque token used to authenticate a user after a successful login

BoundSecret.title: a binding that maps a secret name to a secret manager secret name.

ChangeType.description:
Can be one of:

`0`: Modified ("C")
`1`: Added ("A")
`2`: Deleted ("D")
ChangeType.title: ChangeType Kind of change

CompCheckOutput.description: CompCheckOutput The output format for the compatibility check

CompCheckResource.description: To store the resource (pattern, bp, services etc) used for compatibility check

needed_secret_binding.description:
It is either empty or provides ALL the dependent services needed. It is expected the top level service definitions are provided
in the 'Service' attribute when this attribute is not empty.

ConstraintExpression.title: This type implements all the ConstraintLanguage Plugin methods and delegates to plugin system.

ContainerTopOKBody.description: ContainerTopOKBody OK response to ContainerTop operation

Processes.description:
Each process running in the container, where each is process
is an array of values corresponding to the titles.

ContainerUpdateOKBody.description: ContainerUpdateOKBody OK response to ContainerUpdate operation

Id.description: The ID of the created container

Warnings.description: Warnings encountered when creating the container

FilesystemChange.title: FilesystemChange Change in the container's filesystem.

Path.description: Path to file or directory that has changed.

HardwareRequirement.title: This type is used to abstract the various edge node hardware requirements. The schema is left wide open.

NodePolicy.description:
NodePolicy the node policy
The properties and constraints defined in the top-level are common
properties and constraints that are used by both Deployment and Management.
If the same property name is defined in the second level (Deployment or Management),
the perperty value of the second level takes the precedence.
If there are constraints defined in the second level, all the constraints defined in
the top level will be ignored.

PatternFile.description: It is used when reading json file the user gives us as an input to create the pattern
PatternFile.title: PatternFile An implementation of AbstractPatternFile.

PropertyList.description: This struct represents property values advertised by the policy

SecretBinding.description: The secret binding that maps service secret names to secret manager secret names

SecretDetails.description: SecretDetails The key value pair of one secret

ServiceDefinition.title: This is the structure of the object returned on a GET /service.

ServiceDependency.title: This type is a tuple used to refer to a specific service that is a dependency for the referencing service.

ServiceFile.description: It is used when reading json file the user gives us as input to create the service
ServiceFile.title: ServiceFile An implementation of AbstractServiceFile

UserInput.title: UserInput This type is used to describe a configuration variable that the node owner/user has to set before the service is able to execute on the edge node.

WaitExitError.description: WaitExitError container waiting error, if any
